instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00239: What is 820-00239? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP3V3_G3H: What is PP3V3_G3H? PP3V3_G3H is a 3.3v power line that is present when the machine is in a Global System Hardware Off state, and should come on before most other rails so that the USB-C circuitry can be powered for the charger.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> (5v USB bounce)
threads.message:
Board had water damage. I spent quite a bit of time replacing resistors, caps and anything that looked sketchy.

I plugged in the USB-C charger and 5v for 5 seconds then boot loop. I never get 20v
I am getting <SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H</SIGNAL> at <CHIP>U3200</CHIP>

I have tried the USB ports on the other side of the board as well. same shutdown bounce. So.... I am assuming that I have a failed device somewhere. I checked the rails for shorts and did not find any. One of the USB TI chips?
I don't have much experience with this board. This is probably the second or third one I have worked on.


[URL]https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=IAIvjZOpm-k[/URL]

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> (5v USB bounce)
threads.message: Diode mode all input and LDO lines near the CD3215s. Likely one or more are bad

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> (5v USB bounce)
threads.message:
You sir are a [URL="https://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/steely-eyed_missile_man"]steely-eyed missile man[/URL]!

I found two 1M ohm resistors that were in the underfill region that had corrosion on them. Dug them out and repealed and replaced and I have 20V! I would of never found them without your guidance! Now I know what to look for!

Thank You so much!

Here is the result.
[url]https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3ldFRWYneVs[/url]
